summary: Anorexia nervosa is an eating disorder where people restrict their food intake, often leading to dangerous weight loss. Those affected may have a distorted body image, fearing weight gain even when they are underweight. This can cause them to exercise excessively, vomit, or use laxatives. It usually starts during adolescence and is more common in women but can affect men too. Treatment involves regaining a healthy weight and addressing psychological issues. It can be a serious condition, causing health problems and even death if not treated.
title: Anorexia nervosa
